title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared. Make sure to include your previous role and provide customer service examples. Be yourself Include information about your future goals. Have references available Talk about your future with the organization
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: good i really enjoyed interviewing here since it helped me a lot with expressing my rthoughts in a clear and coherent manner that was helpful for that type of role
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you? How would you reverse a linked list? Tell me about yourself

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: During the interview rotation with the four professors, I was able to gain valuable insight into the academic world and learn about their various research interests. I had the opportunity to introduce myself and answer some naive questions about my experiences, such as my background and what led me to pursue a career as an AI language model. Additionally, I had the chance to ask the professors about their research, their experiences in academia, and their advice for students who are interested in pursuing a similar career path. Overall, it was an insightful and engaging experience that allowed me to broaden my horizons and learn from experts in their respective fields.
Interview Questions: Introduce my lab experience and background.

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The process took 1.5 months from application to interview. There was one 30 minute 1st interview via Teams with just the manager and one team member and another one where I had to make a project and present.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a faculty member who did not want to transfer learning to the digital space?

title: RA2 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth i just was looking for more pay and different hours to work. Thank you for the opportunity to apply for the position. i spoke to someone in the behavioral department
Interview Questions: My weakness and my strengths

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted about 2-3 weeks after I submitted the application. Had the interview the following week on Teams, with both the PI and someone I'd be working with. It felt like an actual conversation and not a Q&A interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? Do you have experience using (software)?

title: RNCase Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: First round of interviews was done with a recruiter from the company. Second round of interview was conducted with hiring manager and clinic manager. Third round of interviews was nine with a panel that consisted of a case manager supervisor, and other case manager throughout the region. The interview was pretty straightforward and well organized. The questions were typical for most interviews. Received an offer the following week.
Interview Questions: A few of the questions are as follows. Please describe a situation where you and a coworker did not agree on a treatment plan or how to handle a patient situation. Please tell us about your experience in case management. Can you describe the type of technology you have used in prior roles. I can you tell us a little bit about her background and history. Please describe what case management is to you. What would you do if you had to fire an employee?

title: Psychiatric Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was very short kind of rude, offered no greeting upon start of the interview, made no eye contact and did not annunciate and was hard to understand due to heavy accent.
Interview Questions: Have you performed Rounds before.

title: Scientific Programmer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with PI over the phone. Mostly talked about my experiences in bioinformatics and he asked some questions about linear algebra. Got accepted after the call without a second round of interview.
Interview Questions: Linear Algebra questions Experiences in bioinformatics

title: CHW position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Process was very straight forward. 
The team members that interviewed me were very nice. The questions they asked were the generic ones you can find on google,  "tell us a bit about yourself",  "what tough situation have you been in and how did you manage to handle it?" etc. To me, it was not hard at all since I am so used to going through interviews however, for a regular person who might not interview a lot, it is a lot of hard questions because they are truly trying to find the appropriate person for the role. I really had a great interview experience.
Interview Questions:
What are some strengths and weaknesses you have?
Tell us about a situation where you had to step up and do something where you might not have been the most experienced in and how did you handle it?
Tell us about a situation you had to adapt to different environment?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Remote interview. Didn’t have to be in person, helps if your moving out of state and looking for a job. Even updates you on interview so you don’t forget which is really convenient due to time change.
Interview Questions: How long have I been working as a medical assistant

title: Coordinator for Educational Programs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Incompetent and ghetto supervisors and interviewers, I could not see myself working here. One interviewer kept looking at his watch ready to go, very rude to me as someone who was interested in the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Was called over the phone, told about the position and the qualifications expected, was asked a few questions about my own background and career goals and then was given time to ask my own questions about the role.
Interview Questions: Tell me a bit about your career goals.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions:
-Evaluated body language
-Presented my previous research
-The employer showed that he is very supportive and available
-Employer is a good teacher
-Micromanagment
-This position needed to be multitasking, hardworking and able to work in weekend and after hours
Interview Questions: I explained about my research and what was my contribution in that research

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions:
It was coincise, very friendly, professional and smooth.
First an application with cover letter, then interview in two stages. first stage with the hiring team and next stage with the Dean.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: After applying,  there was a phone interview followed by a second phone interview.  HR sent information about the benefits and pay scale for review between interviews. The interviews were typical with typical questions. They offer a shadow time for a potential candidate to make sure this is a position they would like.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult aspect of your previous job?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume online and received an email to set up an interview two weeks later. Interviews were remote  Teams calls with two different sets of interviewers. Asked the usual situational questions.
Interview Questions: Name a situation where you were under pressure and you succeed?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: I met with nearly everybody on the team and they could not have been nicer. The head of the team even offered to help me with my parking, there didn't seem to be a hierarchy and I appreciated that.
Interview Questions: What projects did I see myself working on?

title: Assistant Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: A very long process of interviews. The total amount of hours was around 8 hours for a Practice Manager position. I interviewed with 20 different people in multiple different departments
Interview Questions: Tell us about your leadership experience?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Good- they were nice and asked relevant questions. Interview went smoothly. Just had to prepare and the interview was done virtually so no need to be at that physical location.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a little weird. They had me do a virtual interview with two other people. And one was kind of speaking over the other. I know we’re in the middle of a pandemic. But the whole interview process was not very enjoyable.
Interview Questions: They asked me what was one of my weaknesses

title: Registered Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three members of the Neuroscience clinic. I was going to start as an intern. They already knew that I was there to learn and shadow. I was able to answer all the questions and had a good experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Cyber Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with two people, the manager and an employee. The questions were more critical thinking based. They also asked questions about my resume. My references were contacted but I didn't hear anything back.
Interview Questions: "If you were pouring a glass of milk and knocked over the carton, what's the first thing you would do to clean it up."

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by director of APPs via zoom. Asked about me as an introduction, described the role they're offering, then asked behavioral-style questions - "tell us about a time when ____"
Interview Questions:
1. tell us about yourself
2. asked about different jobs on my resume
3. tell us about a time you experienced conflict with a supervising physician
4. how do you handle stressful situations

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview, two interviews, professional and courteous. I felt heard and valued even as a prospective candidate. Definitely one of the better interview processes I've had to deal with over the years.
Interview Questions: Why have I decided to apply?

title: Fellowship Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: 30 minutes wasn’t  too difficult, straightforward questions, great place to work if you’re into status and company names. Living in Dallas now would have loved to stay but no opportunity of growth for me.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Grad school interviews are well-organized with a highly-welcoming atmosphere. Each interviewing student will meet with 4-6 PI's and the rest of the weekend is various social events with further information about the programs.
Interview Questions: Most questions are focused on your research history and the PI's typically may how you would approach a current topic of study in their lab

title: Associate Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Standard Interview Process with a panel of Professionals.  The dialogue is very personable and had the flow of a normal conversation. Be prepared to explain your interest in the role and company at large which is no different than any other interview.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest accomplishment?

title: Senior Grants and Contracts Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview. First phone and the in person was your basic behavioral questions. Full interview process took about three weeks. Also checked references as part of the hiring process. Received and offer and accepted.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself. 
Describe how you stay organized.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: This interview was awful. They wanted someone with a PhD, MD, and 5+ years of admin experience for a job that pays $50,000. They actually took a phone call in the middle of the interview.
Interview Questions:
What medical school experience do you have? 

What graduate experience do you have? 

What experience in university administration do you have?

title: Donor Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Had the worst experience with incredibly elitist hiring manager. Had two phone calls with her over the course  of a couple months finally came in for an interview. The interview was fine but could tell the hiring manager was very very judgemental towards women she felt threatened by. When I thought the interview was over she takes me to an empty office and gives me a skills test that she gave me no warning for. Not only did she spring a test on me she left me in an office where others were working and she had someone else walk me out when I was done. Very awkward to be around people I don’t know taking a test I wasn’t prepared for and at someone desk who just wasn’t there at the time. The most unprofessional experience Ive had. After two months of correspondence the hiring manager sends an email through the automatic system rejecting me. Would never work here.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? A lot of emphasis on how amazing UT Health is.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth. I was called and had a phone interview then I was scheduled for a in person interview where all my questions were answered and everything was explained to me in detail. It was a good interview.
Interview Questions: They asked what I knew about the company.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions:
Situational questions
Friendly
Informative 
They will ask in depth questions regarding your experiences as a nurse. Make sure to come with questions to ask the interviewers. Online interview no due to covid
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a difficult patient

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Several interviews with people from research group. Usually you’re first interviewed by Principal investigator, the lab people and then other PIs. Finally the department chair. 
You prepare a short presentation in person or online and then can meet the people in person or individually virtual meetings. 
Nice environment and collaborations.
Interview Questions: Experience in writing, bench work. Number of Publications and Future goals.

title: Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone interview with Lead Clinician and then an in-person rotating panel interview with the division head, the attendings, and the clinicians. It was a bit chaotic with different people coming into the room and asking me the same questions.
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience working in mental health?

title: Dental Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly easy. Interview questions consisted of basic interview questions. The interview was the easy part. The difficult part was dealing with HR. Not very efficient on their end.
Interview Questions: The basic questions asked during an interview.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
First phone call non technical more of a culture fit call
second interview in person some technical questions in regards to javascript html and css. very light questions nothing overly technical
Interview Questions: What is your experience with html

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
Two interviews 
one over the phone more of a personality and culture fit phone call no technical questions
second one in person with light technical questions regarding experience basic html css js
Interview Questions: What is your favorite css library?

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: I had one brief phone screening and one onsite interview, and received an offer within the same week. The phone screening was a very brief introduction, and the onsite interview was on point as well. The hiring manager and the team obviously read my resume, and I felt they clearly knew what they were looking for. The conversation was packed with information, and the communication was direct, polite, and concise.
Interview Questions:
They asked me very relevant questions. 

Can you use SSMS to write report with SQL? 

What is your career plan?

title: Senior Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Process began with phone interview by one of the other admins; followed by interview with CFO and other admins; then brought back in to meet with Chief of Staff.  Afterwards, asked to apply for new position, references called, then silence.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were standard, but repetitive with each set of interviews.

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Started early in the morning, went really smooth. All interviewers were nice and friendly, and they were focusing on getting to know me better to see if I was a good fit to their team.
Interview Questions: What is your career goal in 5 years?

title: Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Called for an interview. Given a tour of the facilities. Interviewed with three people in an office, a physician, supervisor for the clinicians, and a director. Was given a call by HR to offer a salary.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? How are you when working in interdisciplinary team?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Met with Supervisor and Director the first day.  When I left the building they called me to come back to meet with one of the physicians.  Then a few days later I meet with the admin staff, then was called the next day with an offer.  Started off as an Sr. Support Assistant and have been promoted three times during the five years while employed.  Always room to grow!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?  How are you with difficult personalities?

title: Senior Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Very easy-going, questions were asked from the HR site, you can find their template on interview questions by doing a simple search on their site, it was a relaxed environment.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you speaking with patient's over the phone?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Long with multiple delays. Had to interview with 4 people and was previously scheduled for only 2. overall i kept my composure and did a good job to sound enthusiastic about the job and the company
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy. I interviewed first in June. Offered the position in September due to other staffing changes. Then tried to accept but had to wait because another position needed to be filled. Then October I finally got the job.
Interview Questions: What do I think I could bring to the department?

title: Clinical Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Initially I had 2 shorter phone interviews (1 with HR, the other with a potential colleague), followed by a 3-4 hour long in-person interview session onsite (with different people/groups of people). Because this was supposedly more of an entry-level role, they asked mostly behavioral questions (not specifically deep technical ones). Half an hour was spent taking a basic math/logic/reading comprehension test on paper (which just reminded me of middle school). 

Overall, I had a positive experience and I thought the interviews went well, but what I disliked most was the lack of travel reimbursement. In this day and age, Skype/Webex/etc. interviews should be offered if a company isn't willing to foot the expenses of a candidate to come onsite. I'm not from the Houston area, and luckily I was able to stay with friends there while I was interviewing, but I did have to pay for gas/etc. to get there, which was an expense.
Interview Questions: What's been the proudest moment of your professional life/career so far?

title: Psychiatric Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy, I was emailed about setting up an interview data, came in for a 30-minute interview, met with one of the hiring managers and got a walk-through of the floor. They also relayed my responsibilities and asked if I would be comfortable with the demands.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you worked in a high stress environment.

title: HMC Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I received an email with a few time slots available for an interview. I chose one and attended the interview.  I was interviewed by the Assistant Director of SDR and the business analyst. They’re we’re both very pleasant and easy to talk to. The interview lasted an hour. I was told I would be contacted about their decision in a week or less regardless of whether I was chosen for the job or not.  I never heard back.
Interview Questions: Typical questions about experience and future career goals.

title: GRA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Got phone interview then get into the program.  The question is not too difficult and take about 30 mins.  After a week, get the offer with assistant ship.
Interview Questions: not difficult

title: Clinical Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two phones interviews in addition to a recruiter call. Then an in-person interview as the final interview with my direct supervisor and AVP over clinical technology. It did take them quite some time to get back to me.
Interview Questions: Asked about my technical knowledge; am I able to interact with various stakeholders; being a SME on federal guidelines.

title: Scientific Programmer I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: They had face to face interview which is good that all the team members were getting together. People are nice and kind, but they are very busy so try to be there asap. It may take sometime to find the location and parking your car, so be prepared to go earlier so you have enough time.
Interview Questions: Brief previous experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a straightforward process and I received a decently quick response after application as well as the two rounds of interviews. I had a one on one interview with my direct supervisor and the second round of interview with the head of the department.
Interview Questions: To describe my previous roles

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Directions provided to the building was not clear and was not informed of what to expect for interview.  It took almost two hours with the assessment. The person giving the interview was kind of mellow and not very engaging.
Interview Questions: What do you not like about your previous job?

title: Senior Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews. One with direct manager. The next two were on the same day with two separate senior managers. After that, Human Resources called to verify certain things on the application.
Interview Questions: What would you gain from this position?

title: Standardized Patient Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Very casual, short interview, gave detailed description of position and how program is set up. Explained the importance of this position in helping students understand how to treat patients in climate or hospital or emergency situations.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing in 5 yrs

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I attended a talk by the department head,  afterwards, wrote him an email addressing my interest of working  in his team,  he asked me to go over for an interview. The interviewers were him and another assistant professor.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you are doing.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: They wanna hire someone to do the image segmentation and reconstruction. Basically, you need to prepare a 1-hour talk then talk with the staffs there in details. They will ask something about what you have done and what you wanna do in the near future.
Interview Questions: What do you see your future career?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
They called me to know a little bit more about me. I was not offered an actual interview since they are looking for commitment of more than 2+ years. They were not interested.
The job description is very vague and doesn't say into what research lab you will be applying to, just department.
Interview Questions: What are my future aspirations with UT Health

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met directly with the PI. She was very relaxed in the interview process. The interview was approximately 20 minutes in length. After which she showed me around the lab and introduced me to the equipment used frequently in the laboratory. Immediately following our chat, she invited me to work at the lab, but that I would need to meet with the supervisor to hold a final interview before being officially offered the job.
Interview Questions: Most questions revolved around my relevant work experience and what I was looking to get out of future role. As the PI was familiar with a professor I'd worked with in the past, she was more relaxed in the questions she asked me.

title: Compliance and Grants Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Interview was straightforward but the HR lady basically told me I was overqualified which is annoying. You had my resume ahead of time. You shouldn't waste people's time. I had an hour drive. Also they never even contacted me afterwards. At least let the candidate know Thanks but no thanks. I even sent a thank you follow up and received no response. Unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Explain your experience with grants compliance.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and easy. I met the recruiter in one of the events and told her that I was looking for a position. She requested for my resume and within 2 days scheduled to interview me. The interview process was friendly and conversational. I got the offer.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my computer skills

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. From application to interview took 2 weeks, I would assume it depends on the department.  Interviewed by a panel of people (3). No trick questions. Very nice people.
Interview Questions: Standard work experience/duties questions.

title: Senior Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview followed by an in person interview. The in person interview consisted of an interview with 2 current employees in the office and then a one on one with the rest of the employees.
Interview Questions: Why have I not stayed at a job longer than 6 months?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and personal statement. I was interviewed by the project director. They asked me general questions about my research interests and experience. I received an offer shortly after the interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked about previous positions and skills learned

title: Police Sergeant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was based on a testing and interview process designed to eliminate bias and prejudice.  Unfortunately, the administration failed to follow their own guidelines of choosing the ranking of candidates from top to bottom.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Felt rushed thru the interview from the minute I sat down and interviewer kept pulling folders/files of other candidates onto the table. Questions asked were how my job search was going and what other organizations I was interviewing with instead of questions about my background or fit into the position. Extremely rude and inconsiderate of applicant's time. Red flag of how office environment would be.
Interview Questions: What other organizations are you interviewing with?

title: Clinical Informaticist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and after 2 months I got an email asking me to correct some information on my application. After another month I received a call to set up an interview for the following week. The interview process was pretty straightforward. Basic interview questions, nothing really unexpected. The staff that interviewed me were okay, not particularly friendly. I was told they has interviews for the next 2 weeks and they would get back to me when they were complete. In 2 days I received a call offering me the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me one time that you took charge of a situation at work.

title: Systems Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen and interview with 6-7 person panel. The interview questions were standard and they asked technical questions as well. Personality questions also were asked to see how well you fit in with the group.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Regular interview process. Three faculty members attended. It was a warm environment. They asked almost 15 questions which were very typical. They mainly talked about my resume and cover letter. It is important to have them with you. Also any supporting documents as publications, research papers etc. will be beneficial to have during the interview.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Quick, simple and laid back. Before going to the interview know the mission statement, research history that has been done at the institution, and current research being done. Know your strengths and weaknesses. Make sure to show how interested you are in the institution and why you want to be apart of UT.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UTHealth?

title: Applications Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: It was simple and generic. a little disorganized but adequate. Interviewed by two managers that would be your direct boss, no colleagues interviewed you. Be prepared to answer basic questions and also talk about yourself. Its also somewhat relaxed.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with UTHealth

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Tyler, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: They were very thorough and genuinely interested. They explained the process and were very informative about the job description and requirements. Also allowed time for me to ask any questions and make sure I comprehended everything
Interview Questions: Where I see myself in 10  years

title: Senior Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: IT TAKES ABOUT 2- 3 MONTHS TOTAL. I applied and then received a phone call about 2-3 months later. First, I had an interview over the phone. About a week or two, I went in for an 1:1 with the department executives. Then about 2-3 weeks later I received an offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth and organized interview. Multiple people in interview, have an interview, tour facility, meet staff. Interview was about 2.5 hours long and several questions were asked. Great experience and wonderful staff.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Administration Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I found the interview to be typical.  I was asked questions that are expected in an interview.  I was interviewed by two employees.  They made me feel at ease during my meeting.  Many questions pertained to experience in performing the job duties. No questions were asked regarding situational scenarios.

I was told they had large number of applicants and only a few would be selected for a 2nd interview.  The next business day I was emailed and told other candidates were chosen for the next interview sets.   They did pay for 90% of my parking.
Interview Questions: Do you have any writing or editing experience?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, received an email to schedule a phone interview. I had a brief phone interview s
with the HR consultant. I was invited for a panel interview. Everyone was very nice and easy questions and everyone made me feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: what are weaknesses and strengths?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were three or four interviewers and I had to have one on one interview with them. It was a one-day long interview at UTHealth, but it was done in a stress free environment.
Interview Questions: Why UTHealth?

title: Child Care Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Manager was a very nice woman and didn't give me any stress. Therefore, I felt comfortable to respond all questions she asked. She asked about 5 questions and told me what to expect in the work. After interviewed, she showed me all the classrooms and introduce me to all the staff members. That's all about.
Interview Questions: Can you introduce yourself?

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They did a phone interview , very quick . second was with the manager . very easy couple questions then did a tour of the place i would work . meet with some co workers
Interview Questions:
why you want the job 
how can you help

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (New York, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the PI only. The interview went fine. And didn't go through a lot of details. It is short and mostly the resume and research experiences match. Then it is just a process and then the recommendation letters were requested.
Interview Questions: Like, what experiences do you have on this or that. And based on your resume. Etc.

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Your pretty average interview. I met with multiple members of the team including my direct supervisor and the head of HR. The interview was relatively low pressure and straight forward.
Interview Questions: They asked about my previous work experience as well as where I see myself in the future. Typical interview questions.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, received phone call a week or so later, face to face interviews with various members of research team, including the doctors. More laid back than I imagined.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, things not on your resume.

title: Senior Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Took about three days. Pretty straight forward questions but what we discussed in the interview and the position I applied for is not what I was given when I came here
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5years

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy, laid back, large interview panel (5+ employees). My skills did not entirely match the position (60%) but I was willing to learn - they wanted 99% to match. Although I did not get the job, I learnt a lot from the interview process.
Interview Questions: General HR questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via the UT Health website. Had an in person interview and was offered position in a couple of days. Interview process was really easy, but I'm sure it depends on what department or group you are interviewing with.
Interview Questions: none, easy and friendly

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: positive process. I applied online, waited a few weeks and got a call for the interview. Parking is miserable but they do validate. I was essentially hired before arriving but the salary offer was WAAYYY too low.
Interview Questions: How does my education match the position?

title: Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed well. But my interviewer told me to take off my masters so they could hire me. As a result I ended up with low pay. But overall the process was interesting, I would not say great.
Interview Questions: Normal-Strengths, weaknesses, what can you bring to the table?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: online application, phone interview with Project Directors and Co-Investigators. Then did an in-person interview with team. Investigators asked about passed coursework in undergrad and future goals for school and work. Multiple phone interviews to check quick thinking skills and problem solving tasks.
Interview Questions: Past research experience and relevant coursework

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied via the website. Took 2 weeks to get confirmation that the team received my info. Then the next day I got an interview request via email.

Went to my interview where the head researcher explained the focus of the study. Researcher asked me questions related to my experience. This interview felt more like a chance to explain my interests and experience. Very comfortable. Took about 30 minutes.

Then the next 30 minutes I was interviewed by the research coordinator. This second interview was standard interview process as in coordinator asked the typical questions found in an interview. (what are your strengths, what are your weaknesses, etc).
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected or difficult

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very relaxed. I heard about an opening through a flyer at my university. They just want to ask about past projects and why you want to work in the lab. Professor then discusses ongoing projects in lab. Past experience required may vary depending on the type of lab you work in
Interview Questions: Describe past projects you conducted

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: Received an email asking to me call and schedule an interview. Interviewed with Lab coordinator and a current lab tech. No formal interview questions were asked. Coordinator and lab tech just discussed the duties and daily tasks of the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was notified by email regarding an interview. I had one interview and was offered the position one week after. I interviewed with the department head as well as the medical vice chir.
Interview Questions: All the questions were fairly easy.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy process; I applied online; and was called in a week for a face-to-face interview.; it was a group interview and I met will all the department. I received an offer one month later.
Interview Questions: Why do you want  to work here?

title: Media Relations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: I did a group interview with 5 interviewers. It was scary going in, but everyone was very nice. They did ask what I knew about the University and if I had read the press releases.
Interview Questions: I also had "homework" to do a press release from a study, with a 72 hour turn around. Be prepared!

title: Senior Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: One interview. Supervisor and Finance Project Manager. References never checked. Asked to work right away. Thrown into an unorganized, unstructured environment.
Interview Questions: Was I in California for job interviews?

title: Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The most offensive interview I've ever experienced. Interview by MD researcher who was relatively new to TX, she spent 20 mins ranting about how much she dislikes UT, Texas, the Governor, the Legislature, oil, cowboys, steers and football.  Only asked one question completely unrelated to my education and experience.
Interview Questions: At end of "interview", I had not been asked one question so I asked, "do you have any questions for me", she replied, "No.  Well, yes, where did you get your blouse"?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I sent emails asking for the position that I heard from a friend and then was contacted by two senior employees who performed the same job responsibilities. I was offered an in-person interview about one week later. The two employees interviewed me and then a decision was made.
Interview Questions: Questions were very specific about my previous experiences.

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager e-mailed to set up an interview and I attended the interview next day. It was a face-to-face interview directly in the lab with the hiring person.
Interview Questions: Tell me how are you suitable for the job?

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a very informal and easy experience. I have a technique that could benefit one specific group so I just walked into it. Not a real interview experience so it is likely not very representative.
Interview Questions: They asked about my level of interest int he project.

title: Data Entry Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very casual just asked a few questions about myself and my education. What experience i had with data entry. what kinds of activities i like to do. Asked what i was studying in school, and where i see myself in the next few years.
Interview Questions: What am i studying in college, what computer entry experience i had

title: Nutritionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: A one on one interview was scheduled. Met with clinic manager, some other nutritionist hired had to be interviewed by other Clinic/Admin Nutritionists.  Very friendly environment.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions. Future goals, work ethic, bilingual a must.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called by a lady and asked to come in for an interview. Since I did not have any other engagements, I scheduled the interview for the next day. During the interview, I met with the PI and he asked me a series of questions while explaining the position.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with patient interviews, screening and abstract preparation? Do you intend to pursue further education?

title: Safety Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (South Houston, TX) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple.  I applied online from a job board, and I was called in for a sit-down interview.  The interview lasted approximately 20 minutes, then I was given a short tour of the facility.  Next, I was introduced to my prospective coworkers and I was taken to lunch.  Three days later, I received the offer.
Interview Questions: You have zero experience in one of the primary duties of this position.  Why should I hire you?

title: Admission Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR and they gave me the initial phone interview. It was fairly basic and they said if the Hiring manager was interested they would contact me for an interview. About a week later I was contacted by the hiring manager and asked to come in later.
Interview Questions: If things got difficult would I be able to handle the pressure.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: The research opportunity was posted online and I emailed an application and email of inquiry. The PI asked a series of questions over email prior to the in person interview. After a face to face interview, there was a period of salary and benefits negotiation with a department laboratory manager. The manager increased the offer only slightly but enough that I accepted the position to work closer to the Medical Center.
Interview Questions: Previous relevant experience? Educational background? Specific skills applicable to interviewed job?

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I meet with the former director. Everything went very smooth. Then I suppose to meet with five other faculty members. All of them made me wait very long time before meeting with them. One was eating at his office and left without meeting with me or telling me that he was leaving, so I waited an hour and called the director. The director was apologetic and rescheduled the meeting with the faculty. I eventually meet with the faculty but he was a total jerk. Anyway, the director went back to me in a week and requested letters from all my former employers, it was difficult to get letter from some of the companies but at the end I got the job.
Interview Questions: They want to know if I was willing to collaborate, writing grants.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Short and sweet. Met with boss and manager. Boss talked the whole time about his research. Was not indicative of work would have to do. Given lot as of responsibility later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: The Interview was extremely easy. I really didn't answer many questions. It seemed from the beginning that they were trying to sell me the position. I believe the salary range is under 25K. I was emailed for a second interview with the main research Doctor however I was given little notice And was not able to make it to the interview. Since there are many research programs I cannot say that the interview process will be any way similar.
Interview Questions: What is your best Quality?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UTHealth Houston (Houston, TX) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application through the graduate school first, but was place on the wait-list. The department of MMG inivted me for an interview independently of GSBS. I met with 8 professors for 30 minutes each. It mostly involved listening to them explaining their science and asking interesting questions. I got questions like, what field are you interested in, or what do you want to work on ('scientifically')? Also, what was your undergraduate research about? etc. Mostly science discussion.
Interview Questions: There we no hard questions as long as you are engaged in the scientitifc discussion and have read the research of all of the professors you are going to meet. Do NOT go interview at GSBS without reading about the latest scientific discoveries of the interviewers.
